text: 300ml bottle. Pours almost as pale as water with a medium head. Aroma is light coconut and oily rice. Taste is very sweet with prosecco notes. Some rice in the finish.
Botella 150 ml. Clear colour, sparkling. Sweet fresh flowery fruity aroma. Flavour is sweet and frice fruity, some acid, lively, fresh, soda, nice.
Clear, nice rice aroma, overly sweet and pear taste. Nice long pear and cherry palate, but its a bit too odd for me
Bottle @cgarvieuk - The Xmas Tasting 2016. Pours clear like water. Nose is floral, herbal, slightly sweet. Taste is apple, pineapple.
Bottle at the xmas tasting. Pours clear pale golden, nose is light pineapple, floral, taste is fizzy, fruity, sweet.

Bottle at the 2nd Annual Garvie Christmas Tasting. Pours clear with a few bubbles. More like a sweet white wine than anything up front. Fruity. Sweet wine vibe all the way through. Fizz lifts it above the ordinary. Bit lemonade maybe.
bottle at home ... light hazy golden yellow ... thin white lacing ... soft sweet floral coconut ... soft drying rice .. zezty coconut husk

Tallahassee, Fl - ABC Fine Wine & Spirits - 300 ml bottle. Sparkling chablis-colored pour with excellent bubble action. Sweet aroma, some floral hints, boiled rice. Pleasant flavor, melon fruitiness, steamed rice. Mouthfeel has a nice spritz to it. Been a ling time since I had a sake, was on sale for $4.50, glad I made the leap.

Mio Sparkling junmai 5%

A very active carbonation with a fizzy head. The aroma is sharply sweet candy & oddly earthy. Nice spritzy body. It is somewhat soda like & fruity but tasty.

18.08.2015, 0,3l bottle @ UDON, Barcelona:
Small fizzy shortlasting head, completely clear and colorless. Aroma is fresh with a mild fermented rice touch, followed by mild sweetened lemon soda. Taste is fresh citrusy, like a mild lemon soft drink, with a mild touch of fermented rice. Light and fresh mouthfeel. Very refreshing and drinkable.

Bottle. Pours a very very light gold with a faint, quick dissipating head. Nose is pear and stone fruit with an underlying mushroom earthiness. Very fruity and sweet on the tongue; theres very little true sake flavor underneath. More than anything, its prosecco or moscato, though perhaps with a little THA; it may be brewed traditionally, but the flavor veers so far from sake that I cant call the result traditional. Finish remains short, sweet, and fruity. As a sake, its a disappointment.
Bottle from japanese store, lisbon, portugal. Color is light green to yellow, thin head. Body is medium dry. Taste is medium sweet. Aroma is apple, rice,

Sampled at Slurping Turtle Ann Arbor. Pours water like with visible carbonation that retains slightly at the edges. Aroma has a sweet rice pudding note with just a hint of booze. Flavor is very sweet with light fruit, rice and a hint of creaminess.
The carbo was a bit too much but still ok. Aromas of pineapples and lemons. Quite sweet sour taste with too much pineapple in the taste. Not sure about that one.

Sake from Dae Yang in Düsseldorf. It has got a clear, light vanilla colour with a medium to thin body. Aroma of rice and flowers. Taste of scented rice, flowers and sugary vanilla. Thin finish. Lacks certainly some alcohol for a better taste.

300ml blue bottle bought at Shin Tai Ho (HK)s booth at HKCEC in Wan Chai during HKTDC Food Expo 2014.
Clear, near colourless very pale pear juice colour; Less than one-quarter finger head with soapy white foams which fades in 5 seconds; Small sticky lacing with fizzy carbonation; Fragrant and sweet aroma of glutinous rice wine, with strong pear fresh and juice, pollen, sugar, and light alcohol; Medium to strong sweet taste of sparkling wine, with light sake rice, light apple juice, strong molasses, strong carbo, and faint alcohol; Light body. Slightly thick and slick palate; Mouth feel is thick and very sweet body with lots of carbo. Sake rice character faded into the background. Apple juice ester is almost Cider-like, which blended well with the thick and non-cloying molasses. The hidden 5% booze makes this pretty much an alco-pop Slightly dry after taste; Sweet and thick to mouth.

Comments: So, todays traditional sake brewers now has to tap into non-drinking population to survive, and this is a fine example - alco-pop like, with strong carbo, thick body, sweet cidery taste with hidden low booze. Good for partying, but poor as a Junmai. I am glad I got this as a HK$1 Facebook promotional bargain as I will not buy it again.
